info.name: Oracle Fusion Cloud FIN - Joint Venture Distributions
info.description:
REST API collection for Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials â€” Joint Venture Distributions module.

Created by [Adrian Anderson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aanderson1017/) | [YouTube - Better Human Applications](https://www.youtube.com/@BetterHumanApplications)

item.name: Joint Venture Distributions

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

This header accepts a string value. The string is a semi-colon separated list of <parameter-name>=<parameter-value>. It is used to perform effective date range operations. The accepted parameters are RangeMode, RangeSpan, RangeStartDate, RangeEndDate, RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence. The parameter values are always strings. The possible values for RangeMode are SET_LOGICAL_START, SET_LOGICAL_END, END_DATE, SET_EFFECTIVE_START, SET_EFFECTIVE_END, REPLACE_CORRECTION, REPLACE_UPDATE, RECONCILE_CORRECTION, CORRECTION, RECONCILE_UPDATE, UPDATE, ZAP and DELETE_CHANGES. The possible values for RangeSpan are PHYSICAL_ROW_END_DATE and LOGICAL_ROW_END_DATE. The values for RangeStartDate and RangeEndDate have to be a string representation of a date in yyyy-MM-dd format. The value for RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence must be strings such that when parsed they yield positive integers.

variable.description: (Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key for the Joint Venture Distributions resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Joint Venture Distributions. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Joint Venture Distributions collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of Joint Venture Distributions to get the hash key.

request.description: Reverse draws from partner contributions. This action removes partner contribution IDs from distributions and restores the amount to respective partner contributions.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • accountSegment1; string; The segment 1 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment10; string; The segment 10 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment11; string; The segment 11 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment12; string; The segment 12 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment13; string; The segment 13 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment14; string; The segment 14 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment15; string; The segment 15 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment16; string; The segment 16 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment17; string; The segment 17 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment18; string; The segment 18 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment19; string; The segment 19 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment2; string; The segment 2 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment20; string; The segment 20 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment21; string; The segment 21 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment22; string; The segment 22 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment23; string; The segment 23 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment24; string; The segment 24 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment25; string; The segment 25 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment26; string; The segment 26 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment27; string; The segment 27 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment28; string; The segment 28 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment29; string; The segment 29 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment3; string; The segment 3 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment30; string; The segment 30 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment4; string; The segment 4 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment5; string; The segment 5 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment6; string; The segment 6 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment7; string; The segment 7 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment8; string; The segment 8 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountSegment9; string; The segment 9 value of the account assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • accountedCredit; number; The transaction credit amount in accounting currency.
  • accountedCurrencyCode; string; The currency of the transaction amount.
  • accountedDebit; number; The transaction debit amount in accounting currency.
  • accountingClassCode; string; The accounting classification of the joint venture transaction.
  • accountingDate; string; The date used to determine the accounting period for the transaction.
  • accountingPeriod; string; The name of the fiscal period that the joint venture transaction is associated with.
  • agreement; string; The name of the carried interest agreement associated with the joint venture transaction.
  • assignmentRule; string; The name of the ownership definition assignment rule used to assign the ownership definition or direct billed stakeholder.
  • basisSource; string; The source of the overhead calculation amount.
  • businessUnit; string; The name of the business unit associated with the joint venture.
  • changeReason; string; The reason the joint venture distribution was canceled.
  • changeReasonDetails; string; Additional text to describe the reason the joint venture distribution line was canceled
  • contributionId; integer; The unique identifier of the partner contribution assigned to the joint venture distribution and drawn from.
  • costCenter; string; The cost center segment value associated with the distribution stakeholder.
  • createdBy; string; The user who created the joint venture distribution.
  • createdByJointVentureFlag; boolean; A flag indicating whether the source of the transaction is a joint venture invoice or journal created by joint venture processing. The source of the transaction can also be payments or receipts against an invoice created by joint venture processing.
  • creationDate; string; The date and time when the joint venture distribution was created.
  • directBilledStakeholder; string; The name of the direct billed stakeholder assigned to the joint venture transaction that the distribution was created from.
  • distributedAccountedCredit; number; The distributed credit amount for the stakeholder in accounting currency.
  • distributedAccountedDebit; number; The distributed debit amount for the stakeholder in accounting currency.
  • distributedEnteredCredit; number; The distributed credit amount for the stakeholder in the entered currency.
  • distributedEnteredDebit; number; The distributed debit amount for the stakeholder in the entered currency.
  • distributionId; integer; The unique identifier of the joint venture distribution.
  • distributionLineNumber; integer; The line number of a joint venture distribution and any associated lines created for billing adjustments and partner contribution draws.
  • distributionOnlyFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the joint venture stakeholder is only participating in the transaction distribution and not being invoiced.
  • enteredCredit; number; The transaction credit amount in the entered currency.
  • enteredCurrencyCode; string; The currency code entered on the original transaction.
  • enteredDebit; number; The transaction debit amount in the entered currency.
  • eventTypeCode; string; The event type of the subledger transaction.
  • expenditureBusinessUnit; string; The name of the expenditure business unit in Project Costing that's associated with the subledger accounting entry for the joint venture transaction.
  • expenditureItemDate; string; The date of the expenditure in Project Costing that's associated with the subledger accounting entry for the joint venture transaction.
  • expenditureOrganization; string; The name of the expenditure organization in Project Costing that's associated with the subledger accounting entry for the joint venture transaction.
  • expenditureType; string; The name identifying the expenditure classification.
  • expenditureTypeDescription; string; The description of the expenditure type.
  • invoiceDate; string; The date of the invoice transaction generated for the joint venture distribution.
  • invoiceNumber; string; A unique value that identifies the invoice generated for the joint venture distribution.
  • jointVenture; string; The unique name of the joint venture.
  • jointVentureDescription; string; The description of the joint venture.
  • journalNumber; integer; The unique identifier for the external transaction created for joint venture distributions, for example accounts receivable invoice, credit memo, accounts payable invoice, or journal entry.
  • lastUpdateDate; string; The date and time when the joint venture distribution was last updated.
  • lastUpdatedBy; string; The user who last updated the joint venture distribution.
  • ledger; string; The name of the ledger.
  • legalEntity; string; The name of the legal entity associated with the joint venture.
  • lineType; string; The type of the distribution line for billing adjustments.
  • method; string; The unique name of the overhead method.
  • netAccounted; number; The net transaction amount in the accounting currency.
  • netDistributedAccounted; number; The net distributed amount for the stakeholder in accounted currency.
  • netDistributedEntered; number; The net distributed amount for the stakeholder in entered currency.
  • netEntered; number; The net transaction amount in the entered currency.
  • netOriginalDistributedAccounted; number; The original net amount of the joint venture distribution in the accounted currency. This is the amount prior to being split by partner contributions.
  • netOriginalDistributedEntered; number; The original net amount of the joint venture distribution in the entered currency. This is the amount prior to being split by partner contributions.
  • notes; string; Additional details about the joint venture source transaction.
  • originalDistributedAccountedCredit; number; The original credit amount of the joint venture distribution in the accounting currency. This is the amount prior to being split between partner contributions.
  • originalDistributedAccountedDebit; number; The original debit amount of the joint venture distribution in the accounting currency. This is the amount prior to being split between partner contributions.
  • originalDistributedEnteredCredit; number; The original credit amount of the joint venture distribution in the entered currency. This is the amount prior to being split between partner contributions.
  • originalDistributedEnteredDebit; number; The original debit amount of the joint venture distribution in the entered currency. This is the amount prior to being split between partner contributions.
  • originalOwnershipDefinition; string; The original ownership definition assigned to the joint venture transaction that the distribution was created from.
  • originalStakeholder; string; The name of the stakeholder that was originally associated with the joint venture distribution.
  • ownershipDefinition; string; The name of the ownership definition used to process the distribution.
  • ownershipDefinitionEndDate; string; The end date of the effective date range of the ownership definition.
  • ownershipDefinitionStartDate; string; The start date of the effective date range of the ownership definition.
  • ownershipPercentage; number; The percentage of ownership a stakeholder has in a joint venture transaction.
  • project; string; The name of the project.
  • projectCostingStatus; string; The status of the export to Project Costing.
  • projectNumber; string; The unique identifier of the project.

response.name: The following table describes the default response for this task.

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

This header accepts a string value. The string is a semi-colon separated list of <parameter-name>=<parameter-value>. It is used to perform effective date range operations. The accepted parameters are RangeMode, RangeSpan, RangeStartDate, RangeEndDate, RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence. The parameter values are always strings. The possible values for RangeMode are SET_LOGICAL_START, SET_LOGICAL_END, END_DATE, SET_EFFECTIVE_START, SET_EFFECTIVE_END, REPLACE_CORRECTION, REPLACE_UPDATE, RECONCILE_CORRECTION, CORRECTION, RECONCILE_UPDATE, UPDATE, ZAP and DELETE_CHANGES. The possible values for RangeSpan are PHYSICAL_ROW_END_DATE and LOGICAL_ROW_END_DATE. The values for RangeStartDate and RangeEndDate have to be a string representation of a date in yyyy-MM-dd format. The value for RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence must be strings such that when parsed they yield positive integers.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:

  • accountedCredit; number; The transaction credit amount in accounting currency.
  • accountedCurrencyCode; string; The currency of the transaction amount.
  • accountedDebit; number; The transaction debit amount in accounting currency.
  • accountingClassCode; string; The accounting classification of the joint venture transaction.
  • accountingDate; string; The date used to determine the accounting period for the transaction.
  • accountingPeriod; string; The name of the fiscal period that the joint venture transaction is associated with.
  • agreement; string; The name of the carried interest agreement associated with the joint venture transaction.
  • assignmentRule; string; The name of the ownership definition assignment rule used to assign the ownership definition or direct billed stakeholder.
  • basisSource; string; The source of the overhead calculation amount.
  • businessUnit; string; The name of the business unit associated with the joint venture.
  • changeReason; string; The reason the joint venture distribution was canceled.
  • changeReasonDetails; string; Additional text to describe the reason the joint venture distribution line was canceled
  • contributionId; integer; The unique identifier of the partner contribution assigned to the joint venture distribution and drawn from.
  • costCenter; string; The cost center segment value associated with the distribution stakeholder.
  • createdBy; string; The user who created the joint venture distribution.
  • createdByJointVentureFlag; boolean; A flag indicating whether the source of the transaction is a joint venture invoice or journal created by joint venture processing. The source of the transaction can also be payments or receipts against an invoice created by joint venture processing.
  • creationDate; string; The date and time when the joint venture distribution was created.
  • directBilledStakeholder; string; The name of the direct billed stakeholder assigned to the joint venture transaction that the distribution was created from.
  • distributedAccountedCredit; number; The distributed credit amount for the stakeholder in accounting currency.
  • distributedAccountedDebit; number; The distributed debit amount for the stakeholder in accounting currency.
  • distributedEnteredCredit; number; The distributed credit amount for the stakeholder in the entered currency.
  • distributedEnteredDebit; number; The distributed debit amount for the stakeholder in the entered currency.
  • distributionId; integer; The unique identifier of the joint venture distribution.
  • distributionLineNumber; integer; The line number of a joint venture distribution and any associated lines created for billing adjustments and partner contribution draws.
  • distributionOnlyFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the joint venture stakeholder is only participating in the transaction distribution and not being invoiced.
  • enteredCredit; number; The transaction credit amount in the entered currency.
  • enteredCurrencyCode; string; The currency code entered on the original transaction.
  • enteredDebit; number; The transaction debit amount in the entered currency.
  • eventTypeCode; string; The event type of the subledger transaction.
  • expenditureBusinessUnit; string; The name of the expenditure business unit in Project Costing that's associated with the subledger accounting entry for the joint venture transaction.
  • expenditureItemDate; string; The date of the expenditure in Project Costing that's associated with the subledger accounting entry for the joint venture transaction.
  • expenditureOrganization; string; The name of the expenditure organization in Project Costing that's associated with the subledger accounting entry for the joint venture transaction.
  • expenditureType; string; The name identifying the expenditure classification.
  • expenditureTypeDescription; string; The description of the expenditure type.
  • invoiceDate; string; The date of the invoice transaction generated for the joint venture distribution.
  • invoiceNumber; string; A unique value that identifies the invoice generated for the joint venture distribution.
  • jointVenture; string; The unique name of the joint venture.
  • jointVentureDescription; string; The description of the joint venture.
  • journalNumber; integer; The unique identifier for the external transaction created for joint venture distributions, for example accounts receivable invoice, credit memo, accounts payable invoice, or journal entry.
  • lastUpdateDate; string; The date and time when the joint venture distribution was last updated.
  • lastUpdatedBy; string; The user who last updated the joint venture distribution.
  • ledger; string; The name of the ledger.
  • legalEntity; string; The name of the legal entity associated with the joint venture.
  • lineType; string; The type of the distribution line for billing adjustments.
  • method; string; The unique name of the overhead method.
  • netAccounted; number; The net transaction amount in the accounting currency.
  • netDistributedAccounted; number; The net distributed amount for the stakeholder in accounted currency.
  • netDistributedEntered; number; The net distributed amount for the stakeholder in entered currency.
  • netEntered; number; The net transaction amount in the entered currency.
  • netOriginalDistributedAccounted; number; The original net amount of the joint venture distribution in the accounted currency. This is the amount prior to being split by partner contributions.
  • netOriginalDistributedEntered; number; The original net amount of the joint venture distribution in the entered currency. This is the amount prior to being split by partner contributions.
  • notes; string; Additional details about the joint venture source transaction.
  • originalDistributedAccountedCredit; number; The original credit amount of the joint venture distribution in the accounting currency. This is the amount prior to being split between partner contributions.
  • originalDistributedAccountedDebit; number; The original debit amount of the joint venture distribution in the accounting currency. This is the amount prior to being split between partner contributions.
  • originalDistributedEnteredCredit; number; The original credit amount of the joint venture distribution in the entered currency. This is the amount prior to being split between partner contributions.
  • originalDistributedEnteredDebit; number; The original debit amount of the joint venture distribution in the entered currency. This is the amount prior to being split between partner contributions.
  • originalOwnershipDefinition; string; The original ownership definition assigned to the joint venture transaction that the distribution was created from.
  • originalStakeholder; string; The name of the stakeholder that was originally associated with the joint venture distribution.
  • ownershipDefinition; string; The name of the ownership definition used to process the distribution.
  • ownershipDefinitionEndDate; string; The end date of the effective date range of the ownership definition.
  • ownershipDefinitionStartDate; string; The start date of the effective date range of the ownership definition.
  • ownershipPercentage; number; The percentage of ownership a stakeholder has in a joint venture transaction.
  • project; string; The name of the project.
  • projectCostingStatus; string; The status of the export to Project Costing.
  • projectNumber; string; The unique identifier of the project.

item.description: The joint venture distributions resource is used to view, update, or delete distributions for joint venture transactions.
